title: Making sense of Super Bowl LX: The Seahawks mixed up their game plan, and the Patriots couldn't adapt
content: Let's size up Seattle's defensive wrinkles, an explosive RB, great special teams and Sam Darnold's performance.

title: Seahawks' Walker, 'one of one,' earns MVP honors
content: Buoyed by a first-half surge in which he outgained the entire Patriots offense, Seahawks running back Kenneth Walker III, a pending unrestricted free agent, earned MVP honors as Seattle ran to a 29-13 victory Sunday.

title: 'Her choice': Skiers back injured Vonn's racing try
content: The fallout from Lindsey Vonn's devastating crash in the Olympic downhill included a key question: Should she have been allowed on a course that is dangerous even to perfectly healthy skiers? The answer from the skiing community remains yes.

title: Pearce allegedly crashed into WNBA player's car
content: Falcons rookie James Pearce Jr. allegedly crashed his vehicle into one being driven by WNBA player Rickea Jackson multiple times and struck a police officer with the vehicle while evading arrest, according to the criminal complaint obtained by ESPN.

title: Red-hot Duke rises in women's T25; UConn still 1
content: Duke, riding a 15-game winning streak, climbed six spots to No. 11 in the Associated Press women's basketball Top 25 poll on Monday.

title: Maye: Had injection for ailing shoulder before loss
content: Patriots QB Drake Maye acknowledged he received a pain-killing injection for his injured right throwing shoulder before Sunday's loss, but maintained he was "good to go" for the game and just didn't make enough plays in the end.

title: Red Sox get Durbin in 6-player trade with Brewers
content: The Red Sox filled a need at third base with the acquisition of Caleb Durbin in a six-player trade with the Brewers that sent left-hander Kyle Harrison to Milwaukee.

title: Trial opens in 2006 killing of Miami player Pata
content: Rashaun Jones, 39, has remained in custody for the last 4½ years amid court delays and changes in attorneys on both sides.

title: Olympics seek solution to rash of broken medals
content: Handle with care. That's the message from gold medalist Breezy Johnson at the Winter Olympics after she and other athletes found their medals broke within hours.

title: Next season already? Our way-too-early NFL Power Rankings stack all 32 teams for 2026
content: After the conclusion of the 2025 NFL season, how do all 32 teams stack up for 2026? Here are our early rankings for next season.

title: Nothing left to prove, resilient Sam Darnold makes ultimate statement
content: The QB isn't motivated to prove the haters wrong, but to prove people right. And on Sunday, he did just that.

title: Drake Maye lost his first Super Bowl, and badly. His future -- and the Patriots' -- remains bright
content: Drake Maye and the Patriots weren't able to do much in Super Bowl LX, but their future might still be bright.

title: Winter Olympics: Eileen Gu takes silver, U.S. women's hockey plays Switzerland and more live updates
content: On Monday at the Winter Olympics, Gu won a silver in slopestyle, U.S. women's hockey plays again and snowboard big air medals will be awarded.

title: 'Quad God,' U.S. defend figure skating team gold
content: Ilia Malinin beat Japanese rival Shun Sato in a head-to-head showdown at the Milan Cortina Olympics, helping the U.S. defend its team figure skating gold medal.

title: What this NBA trade deadline revealed: Teams are finding new ways to tank
content: Much to the irritation of some league insiders, the trade deadline was more than just a flurry of moves: It showed the next evolution in teams racing to the bottom.

title: Men's Bubble Watch: Iowa's inch to lock status, more results from a packed weekend
content: Iowa, USC pulled out wins but Ohio State, UCF, West Virginia, Tulsa have work to do after a mixed bubble Sunday.

title: Bracketology: Saint Louis could be a real threat come March
content: The Billikens are an analytical unicorn -- and shaping up to be the Atlantic 10's next generational team.

title: An inside look at how an Olympic ice dance routine is crafted
content: With '90s music as the theme for the 2026 Winter Olympics, ice dance routines have included everything from Madonna to the Spice Girls.

title: Super Bowl records: Who holds the all-time marks after the Seahawks beat the Patriots?
content: Here is a look at Super Bowl records such as most points, most touchdowns and Tom Brady's all-time totals.

title: We ranked every Super Bowl champion, 1-60: How do the 2025 Seahawks stack up?
content: How good was the 2025 Seahawks team? We ranked the Super Bowl LX winner against the other 59 champions.

title: Women's AP Top 25 poll reaction: Duke up, Louisville down, UConn still the 1
content: The No. 11 Blue Devils were the biggest mover in the women's AP Top 25 poll. Here's what's next for every team.

title: Bracketology: Are the No. 1 seeds already locked in?
content: Texas' win over LSU on Thursday makes it tougher for teams such as the Tigers or Vanderbilt to get to a 1-seed.

title: Klopp, Alonso, Guardiola: Predicting what happens to Europe's top managers this summer
content: With the Real Madrid and Manchester United jobs up for grabs, one thing is for certain this summer: The world's best managers will be in high demand.

title: Man City's comeback thriller keeps title hopes alive; Liverpool slip further
content: Man City's two unanswered goals means the title race stays alive and Liverpool's UCL hopes are in doubt.

title: Arsenal stun Man City to boost their UWCL hopes and keep WSL title race alive
content: Arsenal's rejuvenated form since the turn of the year continued on Sunday with a 1-0 win over Women's Super League champions-elect Manchester City.

title: NFL playoffs top moments: From Caleb Williams' miracle TD to the Super Bowl MVP﻿
content: Here's a look at the wild and woolly NFL postseason, from frigid temperatures to trick plays and Super Bowl MVPs.

title: NFL futures: Champion Seahawks, Rams atop Super Bowl LXI odds
content: A champion was just crowned, but it's never too early to look ahead. Here are the odds for Super Bowl LXI.

title: Too soon? Early bets to win Super Bowl LXI
content: We're already thinking about Super Bowl LXI. Here are the contenders and odds that caught our analysts' eyes.

title: 'It's over. Guys are gone': What James Harden and the Clippers realized before the shocking trade
content: The Harden trade was a mutual recognition as much as an admission -- that the 11-time All-Star had a better chance to win elsewhere, and a tumultuous era in LA was effectively over.

title: What NBA insiders are watching amid trade deadline aftermath
content: Tim Bontemps canvases the league after the deadline's grand finale, which now sets up a fascinating summer.

title: America's team: How Cadillac's arrival is already shaking up F1
content: Cadillac is unveiling its first F1 livery in a Super Bowl commercial Sunday night, revealing just how big America's team ambitions are.

title: Fantasy basketball pickups: Collier, Mathurin, Clifford among top players to add
content: Every week in fantasy basketball, there are available players who can help fill holes in your roster. Here are the ones to add for the week ahead.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Man United want Tonali to replace Casemiro
content: Manchester United are showing an interest in Newcastle United midfielder Sandro Tonali. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: TMC welcomes Supreme Court intervention in SIR exercise, calls it big victory for West Bengal
content: The ruling party in the State says the latest development blows apart the ‘ECI’s unilateral move to parachute micro-observers exclusively into Bengal to influence, intimidate, and manipulate the process’

title: Trinamool councillor arrested for allegedly ‘beating elderly man to death’ over illegal construction
content: Arjun Singh, a BJP leader, led a protest march against the Trinamool leader; they scuffled with police and blocked roads; protesters demanded capital punishment and said that the assault was deliberate

title: Workers, employers found Labour Codes credible, forward-looking: government report
content: “The overall perception scores indicate that stakeholders view the Labour Codes as a credible and forward-looking reform, reflecting confidence in their long-term relevance despite the acknowledged transitional nature of the current phase,” a report based on the survey said

title: Activists urge stronger enforcement of Bonded Labour Act
content: According to data around 440 people were rescued from January 2023 till date, of them 209 have yet to receive the initial relief of ₹30,000; the State has fallen behind in the proper implementation of the Act say activists

title: Strike decisively against terrorism, Jammu and Kashmir Lieutenant Governor tells police
content: Manoj Sinha advises police to collaborate with every individual in society to eradicate terror networks; death anniversary of Afzal Guru passes off peacefully in Kashmir, with no shutdown call

title: Standard diabetes test glycated haemoglobin (HbA1c) may mislead in diagnosis of type-2 diabetes in India’s population: experts
content: Any condition that affects the quantity, structure, or lifespan of haemoglobin — such as anaemia, haemoglobinopathies, or other red blood cell disorders — can distort HbA1c values and lead to misleading estimates of average blood glucose, the Lancet viewpoint article notes.

title: Allahabad High Court quashes criminal case against RWA office-bearers, flags misuse of RSS name
content: Says the general body of the society had passed a board resolution, framing parking guidelines to avoid traffic obstruction and hence nothing was done illegally.

title: EC using ‘very restrictive’ software tools unable to fathom ‘natural differences’, says Supreme Court
content: Top court asks poll body to extend claims-objections phase deadline by a week from February 14, directs West Bengal DGP to file a personal affidavit on allegations of violence, burning of documents

title: India, Greece to strengthen defence partnership, expand capacity of military industries
content: “Both Ministers reiterated that the partnership is rooted in shared values of peace, stability, freedom and mutual respect,” says Ministry of Defence

title: Kanpur pan masala baron’s son booked after reckless car crash
content: At least six persons were injured after a speeding Lamborghini, allegedly driven by Shivam Mishra rammed into pedestrians and two-wheelers on VIP Road in Kanpur’s upscale Gwaltoli area

title: BJP condemns Rahul’s ‘systematic sabotage’ of Parliament
content: BJP MP Anil Baluni called it the “height of irony”, that “a party which signed an MoU with the Communist Party of China now seeks to lecture the nation on security”.

title: Foreign Secretary Misri doesn’t refute Trump’s claims, says ‘national interests’ guide oil imports
content: Foreign Secretary Vikram Misri says import of oil decided by “adequate availability, fair pricing, and reliability of supply”; government set to brief parliamentary committee on trade deals with EU and the U.S.

title: Opposition corners Centre over unemployment, farmers’ woes during discussion on Budget in Rajya Sabha
content: Senior Congress leader P. Chidambaram said it was a ‘forgettable’ Budget, prepared by ‘a Finance Minister who forgot her promises made in this House last year’. Of 144 crore people in the country, less than two crore were employed in factories, he said and flagged the poor outcome of the PM’s internship scheme.

title: Congress plans grassroots reboot in T.N., new district chiefs head to Delhi for orientation
content: The Congress undertook Sangathan Srijan Abhiyan (SSA), a State-wide restructuring of its district units, identifying active grassroots leaders, and elevating them to organisational roles

title: Fisherfolk protest at site of proposed Mamallan Reservoir
content: According to a community leader, the fishing community was not given any opportunity to raise objections to the project that will lead to thousands of families losing their livelihoods

title: Gaurav Gogoi threatens to sue Himanta, says CM is ‘trapped’
content: Congress MP Gaurav Gogoi slams Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma for making public information about his minor children; he terms the SIT report against him ‘bogus’

title: Delhi CM Rekha Gupta launches new air monitoring stations, calls for year-round pollution control
content: Delhi Chief Minister Rekha Gupta on Monday said pollution control needs sustained, year-round action as she inaugurated six new Continuous Ambient Air Quality Monitoring System (CAAQMS) stations across the capital.

title: Producer of Rajinikanth’s Kochadaiiyaan should pay fine of ₹2.52 crore or go to jail, orders Madras High Court
content: Justice Sunder Mohan confirms conviction of Murali Manohar in cheque bounce case but modifies six month sentence to just payment of fine

title: Action sought against YSRCP leaders over alleged adulteration of Tirumala laddu
content: Religious leaders and devotees stage protest at Alipiri in Tirupati, demand fast-track court and probe by a sitting judge into alleged use of adulterated ghee in laddu Prasadam during the previous regime

title: A.P. is poised to become ‘eastern gateway of global logistics’, says official
content: The government’s endeavour is to have the lowest logistics cost in India, for which a plan has been prepared, and efforts have started to achieve that goal, says Special Chief Secretary Krishna Babu

title: Starmer on way out? How Epstein revelations could lead to UK's first Muslim prime minister
content: Starmer is not accused of misconduct, and Mandelson has consistently denied any impropriety. Yet British politics does not operate solely on legal thresholds. It operates on perception, timing and instinct. The renewed attention on Epstein has revived a broader unease about elite networks, proximity to power and the sense that some figures are insulated from consequences. In that climate, Mandelson’s return has become a liability rather than an asset, raising uncomfortable questions not about guilt, but about judgement.

title: Pvt players or HAL? Who will build India's 5th gen stealth jet AMCA - explained
content: India's ambitious Advanced Medium Combat Aircraft (AMCA) project is reportedly excluding Hindustan Aeronautics Limited from its development phase, signaling a potential shift towards private industry leadership. This move, amid HAL's existing commitments and Tejas Mk-1A delays, aims to accelerate the development of the indigenous fifth-generation stealth fighter.

title: T20 World Cup: No penalty or sanction for BCB, says ICC
content: Cricket's governing body, the ICC, met with Pakistan and Bangladesh boards. Discussions covered the T20 World Cup and South Asian cricket growth. Bangladesh will face no penalties for its absence from the recent T20 World Cup. The nation will also host an ICC event before 2031. This reaffirms Bangladesh's importance in global cricket.

title: 'Pomegranate can't enter but terrorists do': Pak leader's caustic jab at Munir
content: JUI-F chief Maulana Fazlur Rehman sharply criticized Pakistan's handling of militancy and its Afghanistan policy, questioning how terrorists cross the border while trade is blocked. He also lambasted broader foreign and economic policies as failures, leading to national isolation and declining trust from China regarding CPEC.

title: Microsoft appoints its first 'Engineering Quality Head,' and here's why that matters
content: Microsoft has appointed Charlie Bell, its former security chief, as the company's new engineering quality head — less than a year after CEO Satya Nadella said AI writes 30% of its code. The move comes amid rising Windows 11 bugs, underwhelming Copilot adoption, and growing evidence that AI-generated code introduces more errors than it eliminates.

title: T20 World Cup: Aiden Markram's fifty leads South Africa to 57-run win over Canada
content: Aiden Markram's explosive 59 powered South Africa to a commanding 213/4 against Canada. Despite a valiant 64 from Navneet Dhaliwal, Canada fell short, finishing at 156/8. Lungi Ngidi's 4/31 and a late surge from David Miller and Tristan Stubbs secured a dominant 57-run victory for the Proteas in their T20 World Cup opener.

title: T20 World Cup: 'I request Pakistan to play against India' - BCB President
content: The Bangladesh Cricket Board has urged Pakistan to play the scheduled T20 World Cup match against India on February 15, saying it would serve the interests of the global cricket ecosystem. The appeal came after BCB president Aminul Islam Bulbul's visit to Pakistan, where he praised the PCB for its support and sportsmanship.

title: Russian crude imports to be cut by half? India lays out approach amid trade deal with US
content: On its part the Trump administration has claimed that India has committed to ending both direct and indirect imports of oil from the Russian Federation. The executive order by Trump says that the tariffs on Indian exports to the US could be increased if such crude imports resume.

title: YouTube TV introduces subscription plans: Price, what you get and discounts
content: YouTube TV is launching over 10 new, lower-priced subscription plans, moving away from a one-size-fits-all model. Users can now pay for specific genres like Sports, News, or Entertainment, with introductory discounts available for new subscribers. These flexible bundles aim to offer more control and cost savings while retaining key features like unlimited DVR.

title: Iran’s envoy calls Chabahar Port key to regional connectivity, shared growth with India
content: Iran's ambassador to India highlighted the Chabahar Port project as a testament to strong India-Iran partnership, crucial for regional connectivity and development. This initiative builds upon millennia of shared history and culture.

title: Rajpal Yadav gets emotional before surrender in cheque bounce case
content: Actor Rajpal Yadav surrendered to Tihar jail following a cheque bounce case involving approximately Rs 2.5 crore. The legal battle stems from a 2010 loan for his directorial venture, which failed at the box office. Despite years of appeals and partial repayments, the court dismissed his final extension request, citing a lack of seriousness.

title: Bengal SIR deadline extended, notice to DGP & a msg for states: SC's key orders on Mamata's plea
content: The Supreme Court extended the deadline for West Bengal's electoral roll revision, demanding a personal affidavit from the DGP over alleged threats to election officials. Micro-observers will only assist Electoral Registration Officers, who retain final decision-making power. The court also directed the deployment of Group B officers for the process.

title: Google employees send letter to top execs demanding to cut ties with DHS
content: Nearly 1,000 Google employees are demanding the company sever ties with the Department of Homeland Security, citing contracts with ICE and CBP. They allege Google's technology fuels "state violence and repression." Employees seek transparency on contracts, a Q&A session, and protection for all workers, calling for an end to complicity in government actions.

title: Israel warns it may strike Iran alone; Netanyahu moves up trip to US - is an attack imminent?
content: As Israeli prime minister Netanyahu visits Washington, concerns over US-Iran talks and potential military escalation are high. Israel warns it will act alone if Iran crosses its red line on ballistic missiles, fearing limited US strikes could leave Iran's core capabilities intact. Netanyahu aims to press for stricter terms on Iran's nuclear and missile programs.

title: After scaring Pakistan, Netherlands eye first win of T20 WC against Namibia
content: Associate teams have set the tone at the T20 World Cup, and Scott Edwards-led Netherlands will look to build on their strong showing against Pakistan when they face Gerhard Erasmus' Namibia in Delhi. While the Dutch may carry momentum from a high-intensity opener, Namibia’s consistency promises a closely-fought Group A encounter.

title: Who leaked ex-army chief Naravane's book? Delhi cops file case as digital copy goes viral
content: Rahul Gandhi's insistence on reading purported extracts from the yet-to-be-published Naravane's book shone the spotlight on the rules and regulations that restrict senior military officials from revealing classified information or crucial leadership decisions even after retirement. The book was slated to hit the stands in January 2024, but the Army and the defence ministry asked the publisher not to go ahead until they had reviewed its contents.

title: Travis Kelce felt 'awkward' with Blake Lively & Ryan Reynolds, reports say
content: As Taylor Swift deals with probably being called to court after her controversial text exchange with Blake Lively was made public, it seems Travis Kelce was never fond of their company. Just a few hours ago, an insider has claimed that Travis Kelce reportedly felt uncomfortable while hanging out with the Hollywood power couple and is now pretty concerned about Taylor Swift.

title: NBA trade rumors: Lakers eye $186m Bucks star to join LeBron & Doncic
content: Trade speculation is intensifying around the Lakers potentially acquiring Giannis Antetokounmpo in the 2026 offseason. A hypothetical framework involves a package of Austin Reaves, Rui Hachimura, Dalton Knecht, Adou Thiero, and multiple future draft picks. This move would create a star-studded trio with LeBron James and Luka Dončić, aiming for immediate championship contention.

title: Bad Bunny’s Super Bowl halftime becomes most-watched in history
content: Bad Bunny made Super Bowl history by delivering the most watched halftime show ever at Super Bowl LX. His Spanish-only performance drew 135.4 million viewers, setting a new record. Despite criticism from Donald Trump, audience numbers and engagement showed strong global support for the performance and its cultural impact.

title: Happy Teddy Day 2026: Top 50 wishes, messages and quotes
content: Teddy Day, celebrated annually on February 10, offers a gentle respite during Valentine's Week.  It's a day for simple gestures of comfort and care, reminding loved ones they matter.  From childhood companions to modern relationships, teddy bears symbolize warmth and connection, proving that quiet expressions of affection hold lasting significance.

title: ‘Remember Trump was right…’: US prez sees Dow Jones doubling to 100K
content: Trump has repeatedly argued that his tariff policies have helped rebalance global trade, contributed to international stability, and boosted economic prosperity in the United States through increased revenue from abroad.

title: T20 WC: UAE release all-rounder due to disciplinary issues before opener
content: Muhammad Zohaib was sent back from the UAE squad due to disciplinary issues, with the ECB refusing further comment. UAE captain Muhammad Waseem said India-Pakistan tensions do not affect his team, stressing unity among players of different nationalities. He praised coach Lalchand Rajput’s guidance and said the team is well prepared for their match against New Zealand, drawing confidence from their historic 2023 win over them.

title: Worms from Watergate: When Richard Nixon wanted China to fight India-Pakistan War
content: ​When Bernard asks why, Sir Humphrey explains: “Because once the Prime Minister knows, there will have to be an enquiry, like Watergate. The investigation of a trivial break-in led to one ghastly revelation after another and finally the downfall of a president. The golden rule is don’t lift lids off cans of worms. Everything is connected to everything else.”

title: 8th Pay Commission: Who can give feedback & by when? Check details
content: The 8th Pay Commission was first announced in January 2025, and it was formally notified later through a Ministry of Finance notification issued on November 3, 2025.

title: Kohli, Rohit demoted to Grade B as BCCI announces player contracts
content: BCCI announced annual player contracts for India’s men’s and women’s teams for 2025–26. Grade A includes Shubman Gill, Jasprit Bumrah, Ravindra Jadeja, and women stars Harmanpreet Kaur, Smriti Mandhana, Jemimah Rodrigues, and Deepti Sharma. Senior stars Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli are in Grade B, signalling a shift toward younger players and a new phase in Indian cricket.

title: Are colleges teaching the skills Gen Z needs for today’s workplace?
content: Gen Z is questioning whether college is still the place where work readiness is built. Deloitte’s 2025 Gen Z and Millennial Survey shows what the budding workforce say is missing: Practical exposure, job-relevant curricula, and basic AI fluency. Work now rewards judgement, teamwork, and fast adaptation. Gen Z is, therefore, building employability through experience, feedback, and self-skilling beyond campus.

title: Brittany Mahomes gets emotional over Matthew Stafford’s MVP family tribute
content: Matthew Stafford captured his first AP MVP award after a standout season with the Rams, but it was his family tribute that stole the spotlight. Joined by his four daughters, Stafford became emotional during a touching message calling him a dad first. Brittany Mahomes reacted online, writing, “Okay crying omg,” showing heartfelt support for the moment.

title: Minerals, militants, US-made guns: Why Trump’s bet on Munir is set to fail
content: A recent mosque bombing in Islamabad highlights Pakistan's security challenges, even as its generals offer Washington access to vast mineral wealth. Insurgents, armed with US-made weapons left in Afghanistan, threaten critical mining projects in Balochistan, complicating Pakistan's strategic mineral diplomacy and its balancing act between China and the US.

title: Watch: Armenia ups defence, shows off Indian Akash SAMs, Pinaka
content: Armenia has showcased new Indian-made weapons, including Akash missile systems and Pinaka rocket launchers, marking a significant step in its defence ties with New Delhi. This move signifies Armenia's diversification of arms procurement, seeking alternatives to Soviet and Russian equipment. The deal, valued at $250 million, underscores India's growing role as a defence exporter.

title: 'It felt like a home ground': Nepal pacer reflects after narrow loss to England
content: Nepal's cricket team gave a strong performance against England in their T20 World Cup debut. They narrowly missed a win, scoring just four runs less than England's 185. Nepali batters displayed impressive skills against world-class bowlers. Their passionate fans created a vibrant atmosphere at the Wankhede Stadium. This close match highlights Nepal's growing presence in international cricket.

title: Somalia signs defence pact with Saudi Arabia amid Gulf rivalries in Horn of Africa
content: Somalia and Saudi Arabia have inked a defence pact, bolstering military ties amid growing regional rivalries in the Horn of Africa. This development follows Israel's recognition of Somaliland, a move Somalia views as destabilizing. The agreement aims to enhance Somalia's military capabilities and protect its territorial integrity, signaling a strategic realignment in a crucial trade route.

title: Punjab campus horror: Law student kills girl classmate, then turns gun on himself
content: A shocking murder-suicide unfolded at Usma Law College in Tarn Taran, where a first-year student fatally shot her classmate before taking his own life. Both students, Sandeep Kaur and Prince Raj Singh, were in their first semester. Authorities are investigating the motive, reviewing CCTV footage and witness statements to understand the tragic incident that has left the campus reeling.

title: Japan’s ‘Iron Lady’ Takaichi upends Asia’s power math: And the winner is India
content: Japan's Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi secured a powerful mandate, winning a landslide victory. This political stability empowers Tokyo to significantly reshape its approach to China, strengthen ties with the US, and deepen strategic partnerships with India.  Her decisive win signals a more assertive Japan on the global stage, impacting regional dynamics.

title: 'Won't allow any impediment in SIR': SC's clear message to states on Mamata's plea
content: The Supreme Court has stated it will not permit any obstacles in the ongoing special intensive revision of electoral rolls across states. This comes as West Bengal chief minister Mamata Banerjee filed a petition challenging the revision process in her poll-bound state.

title: 'BJP may even give Bharat Ratna to Godse': Owaisi slams RSS chief's Savarkar remarks
content: AIMIM president Asaduddin Owaisi criticized the BJP and RSS for advocating the Bharat Ratna for V.D. Savarkar, suggesting they might even award it to Mahatma Gandhi's assassin, Nathuram Godse. Owaisi cited the J.L. Kapur Commission report, which identified Savarkar as a conspirator in Gandhi's assassination, and highlighted Maulvi Alauddin as the first prisoner at Cellular Jail, not an RSS member.

title: RSS chief calls Salman Khan inspiration; Farhan Akhtar seeks Rs 40 cr from Ranveer – Top 5 entertainment news
content: Salman Khan reacted positively after RSS Chief Mohan Bhagwat called him an inspiration for college students. Meanwhile, 'Krrish 4' faces a delay due to budget disagreements between Hrithik Roshan and Aditya Chopra.  Additionally, Farhan Akhtar's production house is reportedly demanding Rs 40 crore from Ranveer Singh.

title: 'Staff kept incident hidden for hrs': Newborn charred to death in Kanpur hospital fire
content: A newborn girl tragically perished in a fire that erupted in the NICU of Raja Hospital in Kanpur's Bithoor area. The blaze, reportedly caused by a short circuit, engulfed the infant's bed. Hospital staff allegedly concealed the incident for hours before the distressed parents were informed, leading to a chaotic scene and police intervention.

title: Watergate revelations: Nixon asked China to interfere in India-Pak 1971 War
content: In his grand jury testimony, Nixon described a secret assurance given to Beijing during the war. His full statement reads: “The Russians were supporting India. … Nobody was supporting Pakistan because there was an embargo on the shipment of arms. … But we were giving moral support to them, and also we gave to the Chinese an assurance privately that if India jumped Pakistan and China decided to take on the Indians that we would support them.”

title: Jana Nayagan censor row: Madras HC to hear Vijay starrer case on February 10
content: Thalapathy Vijay's 'Jana Nayagan' censor row is nearing an end as the producers have withdrawn their legal battle. The Madras High Court will hear the case for withdrawal on February 10, 2026. This move allows the film's certification process to proceed with the revising committee, potentially paving the way for its delayed release.

title: ‘Maoism never helped any society’: Shah urges Naxalites to surrender
content: Union home minister Amit Shah declared Maoism's destructive nature, vowing its complete elimination from India by March 31. He urged Naxalites to surrender for rehabilitation, highlighting Chhattisgarh's attractive policy. Shah emphasized development initiatives transforming Bastar, promising significant progress in infrastructure and economic opportunities for tribal communities.

title: T20 WC: Zimbabwe kickstart campaign with dominant win over Oman
content: Zimbabwe dominated Oman in their T20 World Cup match, winning by eight wickets. Fast bowlers Blessing Muzarabani, Richard Ngarava, and Brad Evans dismantled Oman’s batting to limit them to 103 runs. In reply, Brian Bennett’s unbeaten 48 and Brendan Taylor’s 31 guided Zimbabwe to a comfortable chase in just over 13 overs. The win highlighted Zimbabwe’s strong bowling attack and Bennett’s excellent form.

title: Pawan Kalyan lauds forest officials for safe capture of transient tiger
content: Tiger tranquilised after roaming across four States for 53 days; rehabilitation meeting with WII experts deferred to February 10

title: Kerala HC orders VACB probe into gold misappropriation from  flag mast of Sabarimala temple
content: Court says  it may not be appropriate to entrust probe to SIT  investigating other serious and similar offences at the temple. Court passes interim order after  SIT submits details of complaint about alleged misappropriation of gold and cash in connection with  installation of a new flag mast at the temple in 2017

title: Amaravati expansion, irrigation projects likely to dominate A.P. Budget session starting Feb. 11
content: Governor to address joint session on the opening day; Finance Minister to present Budget on February 14, ruling NDA to target YSR Congress Party over attendance of its members in the House

title: Pinarayi lashes out at Assam CM over video targeting Muslims
content: Such nefarious attempts to normalise hate for electoral gains are an affront to our Constitution, says Kerala Chief Minister about a video posted on Assam BJP’s official social media accounts that showed Mr. Sarma appearing to shoot at framed photographs of Muslims

title: A.P. targets to reduce average power purchase cost to ₹3.90 per unit by 2035
content: The State is progressing towards net-zero emissions through green hydrogen production, by building smart grids, increasing the penetration of rooftop solar power, says Vijayanand

title: State unveils R&D vision document for higher education
content: It pitches a global higher education and research ecosystem that is decentralised, digital-first and deeply integrated with the society; moots a shift from teaching-centric model to research-oriented ecosystem

title: YSRCP alleges vendetta politics by coalition government
content: Party says multiple false cases are being foisted on opposition leaders to keep them in jail, calls it violation of human and fundamental rights

title: RJD sticks with LDF in Kerala despite local body election setbacks
content: At a State committee meeting senior leaders shoot down district leaders’ demand for a switch to the UDF camp. State president M.V. Shreyams Kumar says switching allegiance so close to the polls will be suicidal for the party. RJD is seeking to contest five Assembly seats, an increase from the three last time

title: Andhra Pradesh govt. to decriminalise 42 minor offences to boost speed of doing business
content: State to replace prison terms with fines across 13 Acts in Phase I reform push aimed at trust-based governance and reducing compliance burden

title: IMA expresses concern over impact of Kerala Clinical Establishments Act on small hospitals
content: The IMA urged the State government to implement the Act in such a manner that the interests of small hospitals and clinics, which have been providing affordable and quality care to people, were protected

title: Anto Antony threatens legal action against CPI(M) leader Udayabhanu
content: MP challenges both Udayabhanu and Raju, owner of Nedumparambil Credit Syndicate, to produce documentary evidence to substantiate the claim that he had borrowed ₹2 crore for election campaigning

title: Confident Group MD refutes reports of I-T dept. harassment
content: Confident Group managing director T.A. Joseph dismisses allegations linking the I-T investigation to Roy’s death. He says I-T department was only doing their job and that there was no harassment by any officials.

title: Nellore Collector launches toll-free number for epilepsy patients
content: On the occasion of International Epilepsy Day, Himanshu Shukla interacts with medical students during an awareness programme at Narayana Hospital

title: NHAI opens new elevated corridor on Chennai-Bengaluru Highway in Ranipet
content: NHAI officials say the elevated corridor would ease traffic congestion on the service lanes of the stretch, and also prevent accidents, especially at night

title: TMC appeals to Lok Sabha Speaker for revocation of MPs' suspension
content: "We want the House to run and it is the responsibility of the government to run the House; the Opposition should also get time to speak," says TMC national general secretary Abhishek Banerjee

title: No power tariff hike, ‘true-down’ benefits will go to consumers, says A.P. CM Naidu
content: Family Cards will be issued by June to ensure efficient delivery of welfare services, says CM and asks officials to ready Population Management Policy by March

title: Delhi Police to probe leak of Naravane’s book Four Stars of Destiny
content: It was also reported that necessary clearance for publication of the book was yet to be received from the relevant authorities

title: Epstein Aid Maxwell Refuses To Answer Questions From US House Panel
content: Jeffrey Epstein's accomplice Ghislaine Maxwell refused on Monday to answer questions from a US congressional committee, invoking her legal right against self-incrimination, lawmakers said.

title: UP Man, 22, Posing As Income Tax Officials Arrested After Extortion Attempt
content: Police on Monday arrested a 22-year-old man in Sambhal district for posing as an income tax officer, issuing a fake notice to a person and demanding Rs 24 lakh, a police official said.

title: Delhi Businessman Shot Dead Outside Factory In Delhi
content: A 35-year-old businessman was shot dead by unidentified assailants outside an industrial unit in the Bawana Industrial Area of outernorth Delhi on Monday afternoon.

title: "He Wasn't Driving": Lawyer Of Kanpur Businessman's Son Despite Lamborghini Video Proof
content: A speeding Lamborghini ploughed into pedestrians and rammed several vehicles in an upscale area of Kanpur yesterday, injuring six people.

title: Cop's Skeleton Found Inside CRPF Complex 44 Days After He Went Missing
content: A chilling discovery of a human skeleton inside a heavily guarded Central Reserve Police Force (CRPF) complex jolted Madhya Pradesh's Neemuch.

title: For Chandrayaan-4, India May Head Back To Moon's "Gold Rush Zone"
content: India has opened the world's eyes to the Moon's south polar "gold rush region". Now Chandrayaan 4 - the first ambitious lunar sample return mission, likely around 2028 -- homes in on same region to land.

title: Delhi Police Files FIR Over Circulation Of Ex-Army Chief's Unpublished Book
content: The Delhi police has filed a First Information Report (FIR) over the circulation of an unpublished book of Army chief General MM Naravane.

title: "Interim Agreement With US, Not A Trade Deal": P Chidambaram Jabs Centre
content: Senior Congress leader P Chidambaram argued today that what India and the US have arrived at is not a deal but an interim agreement.

title: With 225 Seats, BJP The Single Largest Party In Maharashtra Zilla Parishad Polls
content: The BJP is leading the result for the Maharashtra Zilla Parishad and Panchayat Samiti election. The party has crossed the 200-mark, leading in 218 seats.

title: UP Woman's Body On Road Inside Blanket. AI Leads To Live-In Partner's Arrest
content: A woman's body, wrapped in a blanket and left on the side of the Yamuna Expressway in Agra, triggered a 24-hour investigation that relied not only on conventional policing but also on artificial intelligence (AI).

title: "Something Is Rotten...": Epstein Affair Triggers Crisis Of Trust In Norway
content: From the crown princess to a former prime minister, the Epstein affair has implicated some of Norway's most prominent personalities, triggering a crisis of confidence in a society that prizes trust.

title: "Not Aware": Himanta Sarma On BJP's Deleted 'Point Blank Shot' Video
content: Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma on Monday expressed ignorance of the state BJP's video, which created a controversy and was deleted.

title: At Least 18 Children Hospitalised In Odisha After Eating Ice Cream At Fair
content: At least 18 children were admitted to the hospital after having ice cream in Odisha's Cuttack district on Monday, police said.

title: US Military Bases In The Gulf Under Iran's Ballistic Missile Shadow
content: Amid threats of a war with the US, Iran's Foreign Minister Abbas Araghchi ruled out the fact that Tehran could ever give up enrichment of uranium in its negotiations with Washington.

title: From Braille To Bench: Thanya Nathan to Become Kerala's First Visually Impaired Judge
content: When the Supreme Court last year allowed persons with disabilities to enter the judicial service, 24-year-old Thanya Nathan saw a new opportunity open up.

title: Silent Revolution Taking Place In Tamil Nadu: Vijay-led TVK
content: Actor-politician Vijay-led TVK on Monday said that a silent revolution has begun in Tamil Nadu and took a swipe at the ruling DMK and opposition AIADMK for failing to fulfil prior commitments.

title: Asaduddin Owaisi Files Complaint Against Himanta Sarma For 'Violent Video'
content: AIMIM President Asaduddin Owaisi on Monday lodged a complaint with Hyderabad police demanding immediate criminal action against Assam Chief Minister Himanta Sarma for his "violent video" showing him "shooting Muslims".

title: 10 Days Of 'Severe' Air Quality In Delhi During Winter: Environment Minister
content: Delhi saw 10 days of 'severe' air quality during the winter season (October-January) in 2025-26 as against 31 days in 2016-17, Union Environment Minister Bhupender Yadav said on Monday.

title: Top Court Questions Bengal Government Over Delay In Sharing Officers' Names For SIR Exercise
content: The Supreme Court on Monday, while issuing additional directions to streamline the ongoing SIR in West Bengal, questioned the Mamata Banerjee government over the delay in providing a list of Group-B officers to the Election Commission.

title: See in photos how the Seahawks stopped the run and won the Super Bowl
content: The defense doesn't often take center stage in the NFL's championship game, but the  Seattle Seahawks ' unit took over in its  29-13 win  against the  New England Patriots  in Santa Clara, California Sunday night. The Patriots were scoreless in their 10 possessions of the game, tying the Colts (Super Bowl III) for the fourth-longest drought to begin a Super Bowl, according to Elias Sports Bureau. The Seahawks' defense held the Patriots to four first downs, 51 total yards, 2.0 yards per play and three sacks in the first half. We captured the plays that secured the Seahawks their second Super Bowl win.

title: From Josh Howlin to Barker Playfield: NFL-inspired pups headline Puppy Bowl XXII
content: the Seattle Seahawks and new England Patriots have a roster ready for the spotlight . team Fluff is a terrier-beagle from Nickel City Canine Rescue in Buffalo . she's joined by Barker Playfield, a nod to quarterback Baker Mayfield .

title: Super Bowl 2026 commercials that feature athletes: Serena, Peyton and Hall of Fame tight ends
content: the ads feature athletes during super Bowl LX between the new England Patriots and Seattle Seahawks . the ads are often priceless, but the right ad can be priceless . there's often a hefty price attached to commercials, and this year is no different .

title: Offseason guide for every NFL team
content: the 2026 offseason has begun for every NFL team . how can each team improve over the next seven months to have better results next season? what big decisions are on deck for each front office? we have next steps for all 32 franchises .

title: Play-in push or lottery pick? What's ahead for Giannis and the Milwaukee Bucks
content: the Milwaukee Bucks plan to hold on to Giannis Antetokounmpo for the rest of the season . the team planned to honor the 10th straight All-Star selection before tipoff . sams carania reports the team's intention to keep the team on track . click here for all the latest basketball news .

title: Bad Bunny hosts wedding during Super Bowl LX halftime show
content: the couple featured in Bad Bunny's super bowl LX halftime performance was legally married . the couple was spotlighted several times during the show, beginning with a proposal early on . a billboard read, "The only thing more powerful than hate is love"

title: Baseball is back! The stars, teams and themes we can't wait to see in spring training
content: the new york Mets capped an offseason overhaul with a trade for ace Freddy Peralta . the defending champion los Angeles Dodgers made the biggest splash when they inked no. 1 free agent Kyle Tucker to a four-year, $240 million deal .

title: The NHL's best this week: Can the U.S. beat Canada for a men's hockey gold medal?
content: fans are still talking about the Miracle on Ice from the 1980 games . a new documentary about it was a massive moment in American sports hockey . it's a signature moment of USA hockey success, but we are long overdue for another .

title: 'Go Hawks': Russell Wilson tops reaction to Seahawks' Super Bowl LX title
content: the Seattle Seahawks have won the Super Bowl for the second time in franchise history . the Patriots did not score on any of their first 10 possessions of the game . they tied with the Indianapolis Colts in super Bowl III for the fourth-longest streak .

title: 🎵 Social reaction to Bad Bunny's halftime show
content: Bad Bunny gave fans nearly 13 minutes of energetic entertainment . the Latin trap artist transitioned to "Yo Perreo Sola" in the performance . he brought out Lady Gaga and Ricky Martin as special guest performers .
